title: Michigan Freedom of Information Act. Request: Michigan Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (University Of Michigan Ann Arbor Office Of Budget And Planning)

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Michigan Freedom of Information Act. Request: Michigan Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (University Of Michigan Ann Arbor Office Of Budget And Planning)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the { Michigan Freedom of Information Act. }, I hereby request the following records:

- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.
- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within { 5 days }.

Sincerely,

{ Kayla Henson }

communications.subject: FOIA HEN 0073-23 and HEN 0089-23
communications.communication:
Dear Kayla Henson,

I am writing in response to your Freedom of Information Act requests
directed to the University of Michigan Office of Budget and Planning and to
Michigan Medicine dated January 23, 2023 and January 26, 2023,
respectively.

You requested:

- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and
exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the
provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview
of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated
with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does
not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the
equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its
cancellation.
- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about
cancellation.



Your request is granted. Attached please find the University of Michigan's
current agreement with Coca-Cola. There are no additional responsive
records.


Sincerely,
[image: Shannon Hill signature.jpg]
Shannon Hill
FOIA Coordinator
Freedom of Information Act Office | University of Michigan
http://foia.vpcomm.umich.edu | hillsr@umich.edu | (734) 763-4167

title: Belleville PD Use of Force Policy

communications.communication:

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

title: Florida College Presidents' Pledge to Stop 'Critical Race Theory' (St. Petersburg College, St. Petersburg)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Florida College Presidents' Pledge to Stop 'Critical Race Theory' (St. Petersburg College, St. Petersburg)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any records reflecting or documenting action by your institution as a result of, or intended to satisfy, the commitments made in the January 18, 2023, "Florida College System Presidents Statement on Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Critical Race Theory," available at https://www.fldoe.org/core/fileparse.php/5673/urlt/FCSDEIstatement.pdf.  This request includes, but is not limited to, any memoranda, emails, directives, instructions, or guidance issued to administrators, staff, faculty, or employees concerning the January 18 statement. It also includes, but is not limited to, any calendar entries concerning the January 18 statement. 

2. Any communications to or from the president or provost of your institution (including, but not limited to, memoranda, emails, text messages, or social media messages) concerning the January 18 statement.

3. Any records (including correspondence) sent to the provided in response to Memo No. 23-021, sent on December 28, 2022 by Chris Spencer, Director of the Office of Policy and Budget, directing each institution of higher education to provide certain information by Friday, January 13, 2023.

Please note that this request does not seek a search of faculty or student email accounts or records. These requests should in no way be construed to include a review or search of email accounts, websites, or other forms of data or document retention which are controlled by students, alumni, or faculty members, nor by governmental or advisory bodies controlled by the same, except insofar as any such individuals also serve in an administrative capacity and the records were created or are held by the individual in that capacity. Any search should be limited to documents held by the administration and/or its staff members, including records created or maintained by persons acting in the capacity of administrators or staff members.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Florida College Presidents' Pledge to Stop 'Critical Race Theory' (St. Petersburg College, St. Petersburg)
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon,

The Office of the General Counsel at St. Petersburg College is in receipt of your below request for public records. We will begin the process of identifying and compiling the records. Please be advised that records shall only include records already created and/or maintained by St. Petersburg College, its agents or business affiliates.

The College’s institutional policy is to charge a statutory surcharge for records that require extensive use of information technology resources and/or extensive clerical or supervisory assistance by personnel in addition to the actual cost of duplication, pursuant to § 119.07, Fla. Stat.  The charge for print copies is 15 cents per one-sided copy.  Should the production of the request warrant a surcharge for use of information resources and/or extensive clerical or supervisory assistance, an estimate will be provided.

Please contact me if you have any questions.

Sincerely,

[cid:image001.png@01D93725.9D967060]
Mia Conza
General Counsel
Office of the General Counsel
St. Petersburg College | SPC Downtown Center

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Texas Freedom of Information Act. Request: Texas Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (Texas Tech University)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the { Texas Freedom of Information Act. }, I hereby request the following records:

- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.
- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within { 5 days }.

Sincerely,

{ Kayla Henson }

title: Florida College Presidents' Pledge to Stop 'Critical Race Theory' (College Of Central Florida)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Florida College Presidents' Pledge to Stop 'Critical Race Theory' (College Of Central Florida)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any records reflecting or documenting action by your institution as a result of, or intended to satisfy, the commitments made in the January 18, 2023, "Florida College System Presidents Statement on Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Critical Race Theory," available at https://www.fldoe.org/core/fileparse.php/5673/urlt/FCSDEIstatement.pdf.  This request includes, but is not limited to, any memoranda, emails, directives, instructions, or guidance issued to administrators, staff, faculty, or employees concerning the January 18 statement. It also includes, but is not limited to, any calendar entries concerning the January 18 statement. 

2. Any communications to or from the president or provost of your institution (including, but not limited to, memoranda, emails, text messages, or social media messages) concerning the January 18 statement.

3. Any records (including correspondence) sent to the provided in response to Memo No. 23-021, sent on December 28, 2022 by Chris Spencer, Director of the Office of Policy and Budget, directing each institution of higher education to provide certain information by Friday, January 13, 2023.

Please note that this request does not seek a search of faculty or student email accounts or records. These requests should in no way be construed to include a review or search of email accounts, websites, or other forms of data or document retention which are controlled by students, alumni, or faculty members, nor by governmental or advisory bodies controlled by the same, except insofar as any such individuals also serve in an administrative capacity and the records were created or are held by the individual in that capacity. Any search should be limited to documents held by the administration and/or its staff members, including records created or maintained by persons acting in the capacity of administrators or staff members.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request - CF Response
communications.communication:
To:  Adam Steinbaugh at muckrock.com

In response to your public records request received below, please find the requested items attached per your email request.

Thank you,
Public Records Liaison

title: Police Staff Roster (February 2023) (City of Mercer Island Police Department)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police Staff Roster (February 2023) (City of Mercer Island Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Your first record request #23-99 has been opened.
communications.communication:
City of Mercer Island ************************************************************************ Your first City of Mercer Island record request (request number #23-99) has been submitted. It is currently unpublished and is not available for the general public to view. Pursuant to RCW 42.56.520, the City will respond to your request by either (1) providing the record(s); (2) providing an internet address and link on the agency's web site to the specific records requested; (3) acknowledging that the request has been received and providing a reasonable estimate of the time required to respond to the request; or (4) denying the public record request. Records released are subject to the Fee Schedule (MICC 2.14) as follows: * Photocopies, per page = $0.15 * Printed copies of electronic records, per page = $0.15 * Scanning paper records, per page = $0.10 * Electronic files or attachments uploaded for electronic delivery (email, cloud based data storage service, or other means of electronic delivery), for each four files = $0.05 * Transmission of records in an electronic format or for the use of agency equipment to send the records electronically, per gigabyte (GB) = $0.10 * Any digital storage media or device provided by the agency = Actual cost Request #23-99. ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at City of Mercer Island.

Technical support: See our help page

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Communications referencing the term "next normal" (Niskayuna Central School District)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all emails, paper communications, phone logs, text messages, receipts, invoices, memorandum, meeting notes from/to/cc anyone with the following certifications/licenses/titles:

- School Building Leader
- School Administrator / Supervisor
- School District Leader
- School District Business Leader
- School Board Member

which contain the statement "next normal".

Be sure to include contents of attachments to emails.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

title: Total Allocations for Purchasing and Maintaining Chromebooks

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Total Allocations for Purchasing and Maintaining Chromebooks
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

As a researcher with the nonprofit U.S. Public Interest Research Group (PIRG) in partnership with MASSPIRG (Massachusetts PIRG), I hereby request the following records:

Documents  that relate to the budget for and expenditures, purchases and disbursements for Google Chromebook laptops among all school districts you oversee which have kept such records in the most recently available budget. I’d appreciate the total funds spent procuring Chromebooks, how many Chromebooks were procured, the expected lifecycle of these devices (i.e. how many years the devices are projected to be in use before refreshed with new models), any direct maintenance costs (i.e. funds spent on buying spare parts, paying for repairs, replacing chargers, buying management or security licenses), as well as any funds received for selling or recycling decommissioned Chromebooks.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Lucas Rockett Gutterman

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: P002209-011123
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Dear Lucas Gutterman, 
The Office of District and School Finance at DESE does not collect data that relates to, "the budget for and expenditures, purchases and disbursements for Google Chromebook laptops among all school districts you oversee which have kept such records in the most recently available budget. I’d appreciate the total funds spent procuring Chromebooks, how many Chromebooks were procured, the expected lifecycle of these devices (i.e. how many years the devices are projected to be in use before refreshed with new models), any direct maintenance costs (i.e. funds spent on buying spare parts, paying for repairs, replacing chargers, buying management or security licenses), as well as any funds received for selling or recycling decommissioned Chromebooks." 
I'm not aware of any other units at the agency that collect any of this information either, but I'll let you know if I learn otherwise. 
Let me know if you have any questions, 
Rob O'Donnell 
Director of School Finance

communications.subject: RE: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request #P002209-011123
communications.communication: Thanks for looking into this Rob. Are such records not available because records are not kept of the specific models of educational technology purchased or because no records of ed tech purchases are kept?

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: P002209-011123
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Dear Lucas Gutterman, 
We don't collect detailed data on ed tech purchases at the level that you've requested. We collect data on total district expenditures on student and staff devices, but do not collect data on type or quantity of devices purchased, expected life cycle, or specific costs related to maintaining these devices, etc. You can find what data we do have posted on our website here: https://www.doe.mass.edu/finance/statistics/per-pupil-exp.html. 
Let me know if you have any questions. 
Rob O'Donnell

title: Nebraska Freedom of Information Act. Request: Nebraska Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (University Of Nebraska Lincoln Office Of University Communication)

communications.subject: Nebraska Public Records Act Request: Nebraska Freedom of Information Act. Request: Nebraska Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (University Of Nebraska Lincoln Office Of University Communication)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the { Nebraska Freedom of Information Act. }, I hereby request the following records:

- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.
- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within { 5 days }.

Sincerely,

{ Kayla Henson }

title: Automated License Plate Readers (Indio Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Automated License Plate Readers (Indio Police Department)
communications.communication:
Dear Custodian of Records:

This letter constitutes a request under the California Public Records Act ("CPRA") from the Electronic Frontier Foundation, submitted with the assistance of MuckRock News. 

We request the following records related to Automated License Plate Readers ("ALPRs") and your law enforcement agency ("Agency").

Part A - Information related to ALPR data sharing.

A1. The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares ALPR data;
A2. The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives ALPR data;
A3. The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares “hot list” information;
A4. The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives “hot list” information.
The information requested in items A1-A4 is readily available for extraction through the ALPR software you use. For example, with Vigilant Solutions/Motorola Solutions, this data can be exported easily using the Data Sharing Report function. With Flock Safety, this information is available through the transparency portal function. Other software, such as BOSS, has similar functionality.  

Most agencies have encountered little difficulty in providing this information (see below). In a small number of cases, an agency has interpreted items A1-A4 as requesting the creation of a record that does not exist. We disagree: this data is maintained by your software, can be exported through software your agency has already purchased, and is therefore subject to CPRA. 

However, should you disagree, you may alternatively produce the following records:  

A5. All agreements, memoranda of understanding, requests, or other certifying documents that external agencies have signed to comply with Sec 1798.90.52(b) for accessing your agency's ALPR data. These documents are also often required under the "Releasing ALPR Data" subsection of a California law enforcement agency's SB 34 policy. 
A6. All agreements, memoranda of understanding, requests, or other certifying documents  that your agency has signed pursuant to Sec 1798.90.52(b) to access other agencies' ALPR data.
A7. All "records of access" required by Sec. 1798.90.52(a) for the periods January 1, 2021 until the date of processing this request. 

Items A5-A7 are not necessary if your agency provides the information requested in items A1-A4. We feel that items A1-A4 are more focused and would require less labor from your agency to produce. 

Part B - Information Related to Numbers of “Detections” (plate scans) and “Hits” (plate scans that matched to a hotlist)

B1. The aggregate number of "detections" collected during 2021.
B2.  The aggregate number of “hits” during 2021.
B3. The aggregate number of "detections" from January 1, 2022 until the date this request is processed. If your agency has a retention period shorter than 1 year, please provide whatever data is available based on your retention period. For example, most Flock Safety systems may not have this data beyond 30 days. 
B4.  The aggregate number of “hits” from January 1, 2022 until the date this request is processed. If your agency has a retention period shorter than 1 year, please provide whatever data is available based on your retention period.

The information requested in items B1-B4 is readily available through the ALPR software you use. For example, with Vigilant Solutions/Motorola Solutions, this data can be exported easily using the Hit Ratio Report function. With Flock Safety, this information  is available through the transparency portal function. Other software, such as BOSS, has similar functionality.  As noted above, this information exists within your system and can be easily exported with existing software.

Part C - Assistance, Description, and Recommendations. 

We make the following requests under section 6253.1 of the California Public Records Act

C1. A description of  the information technology and physical location in which the records exist.
C2. Assist us identifying records and information that will help the public understand how ALPR data and hotlists are shared, how much data is collected year-to-year, and how much of that data matches a hot list; and 
C3. Provide suggestions for overcoming any practical basis for denying access to the information sought.

Please note that more than 80 California law enforcement agencies have provided the information requested in Parts A1-A4 and B1-B4 in previous years. For your reference we have included a list below with the names of the agencies that have historically provided these records. 

American Canyon Police Department
Auburn Police Department
Bakersfield Police Department
Beaumont Police Department
Bell Gardens Police Department
Bell Police Department
Belvedere Police Department
Beverly Hills Police Department
Brawley Police Department
Brentwood Police Department

Cypress Police Department
El Segundo Police Department
Fairfield Police Department
Folsom Police Department
Fontana Police Department
Fresno Police Department
Fullerton Police Department
Galt Police Department
Garden Grove Police Department
Gardena Police Department
Glendale Police Department
Hemet Police Department
Hermosa Beach Police Department
Imperial Police Department
Irvine Police Department
La Habra Police Department
La Mesa Police Department
La Verne Police Department
Laguna Beach Police Department
Livermore Police Department
Lodi Police Department
Long Beach Police Department
Marin County Sheriff's Office
Martinez Police Department
Merced Police Department
Mill Valley Police Department
Modesto Police Department
Monterey Park Police Department
Newport Beach Police Department
Oakley Police Department
Orange County Sheriff's Office
Orange Police Department
Palm Springs Police Department
Palos Verdes Estates Police
Pasadena Police Department
Pleasant Hill Police Department
Pomona Police Department
Redlands Police Department
Redondo Beach Police Department
Ripon Police Department
Roseville Police Department
Salinas Police Department
San Bernardino County Sheriff's Office
San Diego County Sheriff's Office
San Diego Police Department
San Mateo County Sheriff's Office
Sausalito Police Department
Simi Valley Police Department
Stanislaus County Sheriff's Office
Stockton Police Department
Tiburon Police Department
Torrance Police Department
Tracy Police Department
Tustin Police Department
West Sacramento Police Department
Westminster Police Department
Woodland Police Department
Yolo County Sheriff's Office
(This URL links to a dataset with links to the records: https://www.eff.org/document/data-driven-2-california-dragnet-data-set ) 

CPRA requires you to undertake reasonable efforts to locate responsive records and to work in good faith with requesters to respond to their request. See CYAC v. City of National City, 220 Cal.App.4th 1385, 1430 (2013). Thus under the CPRA you are obligated to conduct a reasonable search and cannot deny a request merely because it might generate a large volume of records. 

We ask that you please respond to this request within 10 days either by providing all the requested records or by providing a written response setting forth the legal authority on which you rely in withholding or redacting any document, as well as stating when documents will be made available. Should you choose to withhold or reject this request, we ask that you provide an explanation of why your agency is responding differently compared to the many others that have complied with our request. 

We also request that any records maintained in an electronic format be provided in that same format (such as a PDF, CSV or XLS file), to avoid copying costs.

However, should you be unable to do so, EFF will reimburse you for the direct costs of copying these records (if you elect to charge for copying) plus postage. If you anticipate that these costs will exceed $25.00, or that the time needed to copy the records will delay their release, please contact me so that I can arrange to inspect the documents or decide which documents I wish to have copied. Please also provide an invoice and a cost breakdown of the fee estimate. If the fees are less than $25.00, please copy and send the records and invoice as soon as possible, and we will promptly pay the required costs.

Thank you for your consideration of this request. If you have any questions or concerns, or if I can provide any clarification that will help identify responsive documents or focus this request, please do not hesitate to contact me at (415) 436-9333 x151 or dm@eff.org. You may also mail correspondence to the Electronic Frontier Foundation, 815 Eddy. St. San Francisco, CA, 94109.
                                               
Sincerely,
 
 
Dave Maass
Director of Investigations
Electronic Frontier Foundation

communications.subject: Erika Martinez shared "MuckRock Media PRA Request ALPR" with you
communications.communication:
Hi there,

Erika Martinez (emartinez@indiopd.org) invited you to edit the folder " MuckRock Media PRA Request ALPR " on Dropbox.

Erika said:
"Dear Requester,

Enclosed is Batch 1 of the requested responsive records per your 11/3/22 PRA request for ALPR readers. This batch includes  the following types of records: Indio Policy #458 Flock Safety Policy, Indio Policy #351 Outside Agency Assistance, Flock Services Agreement between the City of Indio and Flock Technology 2022, ALPR software agreement with PIPS Neology, as well as ALPR audit reports for the period of January 2021 through November 2022. 

Staff continues to review and redact certain exempt information, under Gov. Code 6250. We will release additional responsive records on a rolling basis. 

Thank you in advance for your patience. 

Regards,

Erika Martinez"

Go to folder[1]

Enjoy!
The Dropbox team

[1]: https://www.dropbox.com/l/scl/AAD0zdPbhvhw_cykpEWLXzO1xVeqESkiOIA

communications.subject: Hi Dave, welcome to Dropbox!
communications.communication:
Let’s get started  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌       Welcome!
 Let’s get you started We’re excited to get you up and running! Whether you’re looking to back up your devices or share pics and videos with friends and colleagues, let us show you how easy it can be. Dropbox is made for this stuff.  Get started[1]        Upload & share now First things first, it’s time to add your first file to your new Dropbox account. Soon, you’ll be saving storage space, sharing photos with family and friends, and collaborating on important documents with colleagues. Start uploading & sharing[1]         Got photos? Store & share them securely When you keep your family photos in the cloud, you can easily share them with your loved ones without ever worrying about them getting lost. Learn how to upload, organize, and share all of your best memories in Dropbox. Learn how[2]        Start using Dropbox  Want to learn how to start uploading all your important docs, photos, videos, and more to your Dropbox?    Let's go[3]

communications.subject: Check out what you get with your plan
communications.communication:
Dropbox has features just for you  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌      Discover all the powerful tools in your account Connect with team members and clients in innovative and time-saving ways, execute legally binding eSignatures, consolidate video feedback, send large files, and so much more. Learn how Dropbox is working hard to make your work less complicated.    Stay in the know         Share and make it interesting (and fast)  Use Dropbox Capture to create screen recordings with GIFs, screenshots, voiceovers, and markups to help you say more in less time. BONUS: Get extra minutes of recording time when you refer new Capture users!
   Start capturing            Make it official with eSignatures  Have leases, tax forms, onboarding paperwork, or any other documents that need signing? Dropbox lets you securely send, sign, and store documents directly from your account.
   Start eSigning            Get to final_final faster  Skip the endless email chains and back-and-forth feedback loops. Dropbox Replay makes it easy to consolidate comments, take action on feedback, and finalize your video and audio projects. Also, commenters don’t even need a Dropbox account. 
   Learn how to Replay            Need to send files securely and efficiently  Final delivery shouldn’t be a hassle. Use Dropbox Transfer to easily and securely send large files or collections of files. You can track downloads, control file access, and prevent unwanted edits to your original files. It only takes a couple clicks.
   Start transferring            If any of this sounds like it can help make your life a little easier, take a minute to compare our different offerings.   Compare Dropbox products

communications.subject: There’s a plan for everyone
communications.communication:
Learn which Dropbox plan is for you  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌      The perfect plan? 
 It was here all along Whether you are uploading content to the cloud, sharing photos with family, building a business, or managing a team, Dropbox has a plan to keep your life moving forward.    Find my plan         Dropbox Plus: More of the good stuff  Deleting old photos and videos to make room for new ones isn't the solution. Instead, get the space you need to keep all of your files stored securely in one organized place that you can access anytime, anywhere.
   Try Plus for free            Dropbox Family: Together we can do more  Tired of being the family’s tech support? Skip the back and forth and come together with 2,000 GB (that’s about 500,000 photos) of shared cloud storage. While everyone gets their own account for photos, passwords, and docs, the Family Room is where you can share anything from pictures and recipes to medical records and copies of your new lease.
   Get on the Family plan            Dropbox Pro: Because you mean business  Running a small business can pull you in every direction. Get the tools you need to put all the pieces together—without leaving Dropbox. From large file transfers and custom branding to eSignatures and watermarking, Dropbox Pro has what you need to always deliver your best work.
   Start your free trial            Dropbox Teams: Optimize your workflow  Does it feel like you spend more time switching between programs than actually being focused? Bring everything you need to work together in one place. Get more done in less time when your team is connected and can access all the tools and content in Dropbox.
   Get started            If any of this sounds like it can help make your life a little easier, take a minute to compare our different offerings.   Compare Dropbox products

communications.subject: Updates to our Terms of Service and Privacy Policy
communications.communication:
Hi Dave, We’re constantly looking for ways to improve the Dropbox experience and expand our feature offerings. In the past few years, we welcomed HelloSign—now Dropbox Sign—and DocSend to the Dropbox family, and now we’ll be offering these services as an integrated part of Dropbox. If you haven’t used these services before, you’ll now be able to access them from your Dropbox account. We’re making a few updates to our Terms of Service and Privacy Policy to reflect these and some other changes: Terms of Service We added language to cover use of the Dropbox Sign and DocSend services. We added language clarifying your responsibilities should you choose to enable third- party integrations with Dropbox. We now refer to Dropbox Business teams as Dropbox Teams and have updated the Terms of Service accordingly. Privacy Policy We added information to explain how data collection works if you use DocSend, viewer insights on content viewed in Dropbox, or our eSignature services. We’ve added information to clarify how we use your data when you interact with Dropbox representatives in certain marketing contexts. We now refer to Dropbox Business teams as Dropbox Teams and have updated the Privacy Policy accordingly. Please look at the full Terms of Service[1] and Privacy Policy[2] . These will go into effect on April 3, 2023. By continuing to use Dropbox after this date, you are agreeing to the new terms. You can also find our previous Terms here[3] . For more details, visit our Help Center[4] . Thanks! -The Dropbox Team

title: McKinsey & Company / Tomas J. Aragon: SFDPH COVID-19 Emails, 2020
tags: san francisco department of public health

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: McKinsey & Company / Tomas J. Aragon: SFDPH COVID-19 Emails, 2020
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1.  All emails to/from/between San Francisco Dept. of Public Health director Tomas J. Aragon and any email address originating from, or ending in, " @mckinsey.com " between the dates of 3/1/2020 and 12/1/2020.

Please make sure to include any attachments to those emails.

If it is not possible for your agency to conduct a search for emails originating from a specific domain, such as @mckinsey.com, please let me know and I can provide you with a specific list of McKinsey email addresses to search for instead.

McKinsey & Co. is a global management consulting firm whose work regarding various government responses to COVID-19, including vaccination efforts, have come under scrutiny recently in the U.S. (https://www.propublica.org/article/how-mckinsey-is-making-100-million-and-counting-advising-on-the-governments-bumbling-coronavirus-response) and in France (https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/22/business/france-mckinsey-consultants-covid-vaccine.html). The firm's government contracts were also the subject of a recent public records lawsuit in Tennessee (https://finance.yahoo.com/news/tennessee-sued-not-releasing-covid-221610057.html). McKinsey & Co. also recently came under scrutiny in the national press over potential conflicts of interest related to the firm's relationships with pharmaceutical companies and regulators (https://www.nytimes.com/2022/04/13/business/mckinsey-purdue-fda-records.html). 

During the pandemic in 2020, the State of California had contracts with McKinsey and Company, which are disclosed on the state's COVID-19 contract disclosure website: https://covid19.ca.gov/contracts/

Based on that information, fully understanding how State officials interacted with McKinsey & Co. consultants when developing California's COVID-19 response, including the information and advice that was provided to State officials by McKinsey & Co. regarding COVID-19, is of the highest importance to the public. The requested information should be made available to the public with as few redactions as possible, and at the lowest fee possible, as soon as possible.

When providing the records related to this request, please specifically certify that no other responsive documents related to this request exist.

The requested information will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. Disclosure of the requested information to me is in the public interest because it is likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of the operations and/or activities of the government, and is not primarily in my commercial interest.

In order to help determine my status to assess fees, you should know that I am a freelance journalist whose work is published regularly by print and digital news outlets and magazines. You can view my portfolio at www.erinmariemiller.com/clips. I have previously been determined a media requester by federal agencies in other FOIA requests. As a member of the media, I request a waiver of all fees. In the event that there are fees, I am willing to pay up to $25 for the requested information. If the fee for this request exceeds this amount, please notify me in writing for permission prior to beginning work on the request.

I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Please send all documents related to this request to this email address.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.


Sincerely,

Erin Marie Miller

The firm's government contracts were also the subject of a recent public records lawsuit in Tennessee (https://finance.yahoo.com/news/tennessee-sued-not-releasing-covid-221610057.html). McKinsey & Co. also recently came under scrutiny in the national press over potential conflicts of interest related to the firm's relationships with pharmaceutical companies and regulators (https://www.nytimes.com/2022/04/13/business/mckinsey-purdue-fda-records.html).

During the pandemic in 2020, the State of California had contracts with McKinsey and Company, which are disclosed on the state's COVID-19 contract disclosure website: https://covid19.ca.gov/contracts/

Based on that information, fully understanding how State officials interacted with McKinsey & Co. consultants when developing California's COVID-19 response, including the information and advice that was provided to State officials by McKinsey & Co. regarding COVID-19, is of the highest importance to the public. The requested information should be made available to the public with as few redactions as possible, and at the lowest fee possible, as soon as possible.

When providing the records related to this request, please specifically certify that no other responsive documents related to this request exist.

The requested information will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. Disclosure of the requested information to me is in the public interest because it is likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of the operations and/or activities of the government, and is not primarily in my commercial interest.

In order to help determine my status to assess fees, you should know that I am a freelance journalist whose work is published regularly by print and digital news outlets and magazines. You can view my portfolio at www.erinmariemiller.com/clips. I have previously been determined a media requester by federal agencies in other FOIA requests. As a member of the media, I request a waiver of all fees. In the event that there are fees, I am willing to pay up to $25 for the requested information. If the fee for this request exceeds this amount, please notify me in writing for permission prior to beginning work on the request.

I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Please send all documents related to this request to this email address.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Erin Marie Miller

We have located responsive records, which are available to you here.  Please note that due to privacy concerns, some personal information, such as personal phone numbers, cell numbers and email addresses, have been redacted from the documents that we are making available to you. We redacted this personal information pursuant to Section 7927.700 and Section 7927.705 of the California Public Records Act and Article 1, Section 1 of the California Constitution.  Cal. Govt. C. Sec. 7929.210: Nothing in this chapter shall be construed to require the disclosure of an information security record of a public agency, if, on the facts of the particular case, disclosure of that record would reveal vulnerabilities to, or otherwise increase the potential for an attack on, an information technology system of a public agency. Nothing in this section shall be construed to limit public disclosure of records stored within an information technology system of a public agency that are not otherwise exempt from disclosure pursuant to this chapter or any other provision of law.  This concludes your public records request. ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police Staff Roster (February 2023) (Centralia Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. The number of criminal complaints filed between January 1, 2021, through January 1, 2023, that included an alleged violation of Penal Code section 148 as the sole Count in the complaint,  with a breakdown of the Race, Ethnicity, and/or National Origin of the charged defendant.

2. Any list or database of criminal complaints filed between January 1, 2021, through January 1, 2023, that included an alleged violation of Penal Code section 148 as the sole Count in the complaint, with a breakdown of the Race, Ethnicity, and/or National Origin of the charged defendant.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] California Public Records Act Request: P.C. 148 Data
communications.communication:
Dear Requester,



I write in response to your December 22, 2022 California Public Records Act (CPRA) request to the County of Santa Clara Office of the District Attorney ("DA's Office").  Your request sought:  (1) The number of criminal complaints filed between January 1, 2021, through January 1, 2023, that included an alleged violation of Penal Code section 148 as the sole Count in the complaint, with a breakdown of the Race, Ethnicity, and/or National Origin of the charged defendant; and (2) Any list or database of criminal complaints filed between January 1, 2021, through January 1, 2023, that included an alleged violation of Penal Code section 148 as the sole Count in the complaint, with a breakdown of the Race, Ethnicity, and/or National Origin of the charged defendant.



With respect to Request No. 1, the DA's Office can provide the number of complaints with a breakdown of the race of the charged defendant.  However, the DA's Office does not track the ethnicity or national origin of defendants and therefore is unable to provide you with that information.  Please let me know if you would like the DA's Office to proceed with gathering the number of criminal complaints filed between January 1, 2021 and January 1, 2023 that include an alleged violation of Penal Code section 148 as the sole Count in the complaint with a breakdown of the race of the charged defendant.  If so, the DA's Office can provide you with the cost of the task pursuant to Government Code section 6253.9(b)(2) and instructions on how to submit payment.



With respect to Request No. 2, the right to privacy under the California Constitution and the regulatory scheme regarding criminal offender record information prohibits production of a list or database of the criminal complaints you request.  See Cal. Const. art. I, § 1; Gov. Code § 6254(k); Penal Code § 13100 et seq. (in particular, Penal Code §§ 13102, 13201, 13300, 13303, 13304, 13305); Craig v. Municipal Court (1979) 100 Cal.App.3d 69; Westbrook v. County of Los Angeles (1994) 27 Cal.App.4th 157.



Finally, you may be interested in information contained in the DA's Office Race and Prosecutions report, which can be found here:  Race Prosecutions 2022 Report - Combined with Appendix.pdf (sccgov.org)<https://countyda.sccgov.org/sites/g/files/exjcpb1121/files/documents/Race%20Prosecutions%202022%20Report%20-%20Combined%20with%20Appendix.pdf>.  Information regarding Penal Code 148 can be found on page 22.



I look forward to hearing from you regarding Request No. 1.  If we do not hear from you by January 13, 2022, the County will consider this request closed.



Regards,
Shana

communications.communication:
Please proceed with fulfilling each request to the extent possible. 

In response to a similar requests that is publicly available on Muckrock.com, the Santa Clara County Office of the District Attorney provided the attached data with a list of complaints by case number, race, and offense level.  No personal data was included.

Since the Santa Clara County Office of the District Attorney has provided this information in the past with regards to PC 594 cases, it is not clear that the citations provided would prevent the same office from providing the same date with regards to PC 148 cases. 

Regardless, please proceed with fulfilling each request to the extent possible.

Anonymous Anon

title: Police Data Collection Request (2021)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Police Data Collection Request (2021)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. the total number of use of force incidents, separated by type of force and year used in 2021 (for example, information that specifies the number of taser incidents in 2021, baton incidents in 2021, etc.)
 
2. the total number of civilian complaints alleging any form of law enforcement misconduct that were reported and the total number sustained in 2021.
 
3. the total number of civilian complaints alleging law enforcement use of excessive force that were reported and the total number sustained in 2021.
 
4. the total number of civilian complaints alleging biased policing or racial profiling that were reported and the total number sustained in 2021.
 
5. the total number of civilian complaints alleging criminal conduct that were reported and the total number sustained in 2021.
 
6. the total number of officer involved shootings in 2021, both fatal and non-fatal.
 
When available, I would appreciate being sent individualized data for each item in this request in spreadsheet format. If individualized data are unavailable, please send information that includes aggregate statistics for the item instead.
 
Note that my requests for civilian complaints are specifically for civilian complaints alleging police misconduct, please do not include complaints filed by one officer/the department against another officer.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

title: Air Pollution, Odor or Dust Complaints from 2010-2022

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Air Pollution, Odor or Dust Complaints from 2010-2022
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

All "Air Pollution, Odor or Dust Complaint Requests" submitted to Chicago 311 from January 1st, 2010 to January 1, 2022. I am requesting the "complaint request" in the category of "Air Pollution, Odor or Dust," which is the raw intake of "Air Pollution, Odor or Dust Complaint Requests." Last August, I received  this data for the year of 2022 (https://www.muckrock.com/foi/chicago-169/air-pollution-odor-or-dust-complaint-request-132006/). I'm requesting the same data, in the same form, but for the years 2010 to 2022. 

Thus, I request the raw data - in a machine-readable database or spreadsheet format such as Excel, CSV, Access, SQL or XML - pertaining to "Air Pollution, Odor or Dust Complaint Requests." The data should include all fields in the database or spreadsheets that contain non-exempt information. I also request all documentation that describes the layout of the database’s tables and fields, and that provides the definitions of any field names, codes, and abbreviations used in the database. This information may be gathered together in a single document like a data dictionary, entity layout, or user's guide. If that is the case, I request access to and copy of said document.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

Dear Mr. Bergin,

Due to the volume of records associated with the 12-year time period of your FOIA request, additional research from the retired legacy system, records review and report development for different reporting applications is necessary to complete your FOIA request.

As such, this is an official request for an additional extension of 3 business days needed to complete the task.

If this is amenable, please reply to this email.

Thank you in advance for your consideration.

Sincerely,

M.D. Ward
Freedom of Information Act Officer
311 City Services
e: 311foia@cityofchicago.org
p: 312-746-9760

communications.subject: RE: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request #F038527-012023
communications.communication:
Hi M.D.,

This is completely fine by me! I appreciate your time and effort in navigating the changes to 311 system historically. 

If there is a way to fulfill this request for the more recent system data, and give you more time to fulfill the data from the old system, I would also be amendable to that. I can imagine the older system and data won't be as smooth of retrieval process on your end. 

Thanks for your help. 

My best,
Dillon

title: Francisco Gomez and Amber Donovan

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Francisco Gomez and Amber Donovan
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any records or emails pertaining to Cisco Gomez. Focusing in on his position as Maintenance and Grounds Supervisor. Looking for information related to complaints about him from staff. Include any emails from John Mannix, Karen Mooseker, Keith Stefenson and District Office staff that have anything to do about any complaints from staff against Cisco Gomez. Between the years of 2015 to 2022. 
Any records or emails pertaining to Amber Donovan that have anything to do with lewd texting and videos being sent to subordinates. Focusing in on her position as Custodial manager, Coordinator. Between the years of 2020 to 2022.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rex Anthony Sites

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Francisco Gomez and Amber Donovan
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Washington Public Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Dec. 8, 2022. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Francisco Gomez and Amber Donovan
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sites,

On behalf of the district's Public Records Officer Simone Neal, and pursuant to RCW 42.56.520, this email acknowledges receipt of the public records request you submitted to the Mukilteo School District on December 8, 2022.  Specifically, you requested:

"Any records or emails pertaining to Cisco Gomez. Focusing in on his position as Maintenance and Grounds Supervisor. Looking for information related to complaints about him from staff. Include any emails from John Mannix, Karen Mooseker, Keith Stefenson and District Office staff that have anything to do about any complaints from staff against Cisco Gomez. Between the years of 2015 to 2022."

"Any records or emails pertaining to Amber Donovan that have anything to do with lewd texting and videos being sent to subordinates. Focusing in on her position as Custodial manager, Coordinator. Between the years of 2020 to 2022."

The district is processing your request.  The district anticipates that the first installment of records responsive to your request will be available no later than February 1, 2023.  This additional time is necessary, per RCW 42.56.520, to locate and assemble the information requested, to determine whether any of the information you requested is exempt from public disclosure and produce a corresponding exemption log, and to notify any third party affected by the request.  As documents responsive to your request are ready for disclosure, they will be provided to you.

Sincerely,

Kirk Barney
Director of Human Resources
Mukilteo School District
9401 Sharon Drive
Everett, Washington 98204
425-356-1298
barneykd@mukilteo.wednet.edu<mailto:barneykd@mukilteo.wednet.edu>
Pronouns: he/him/his

Employment Opportunities - https://www.mukilteoschools.org/Page/937

[Image]

The information transmitted is intended only for the person or entity to which it is addressed and may contain confidential and/or privileged material, the disclosure of which is governed by applicable law. Any review, retransmission, dissemination or other use of, or taking of any action in reliance upon, this information by persons or entities other than the intended recipient is prohibited. If you received this in error, please contact the sender and destroy the materials contained in this message.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Francisco Gomez and Amber Donovan
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sites,

In my December 15, 2022, email to you in response to your December 8, 2022 request for records, I estimated the first installment of those records would be available to you by February 1, 2023.

In our subsequent search for records, we have found over 23,300 email records that may be responsive to your request for "Any records or emails pertaining to Cisco Gomez. Focusing in on his position as Maintenance and Grounds Supervisor. Looking for information related to complaints about him from staff. Include any emails from John Mannix, Karen Mooseker, Keith Stefenson and District Office staff that have anything to do about any complaints from staff against Cisco Gomez. Between the years of 2015 to 2022."

With the way your request is worded and in order to provide you with all the emails you are requesting, we will need to review each one of the 23,300 records to determine if they are responsive and possibly make redactions to the records.  This will take a significant amount of time.  Therefore, we invite you to narrow your request.  Are there any more specific terms you would like to provide regarding specific complaints or individuals for whom you are looking for records?

If you would like to proceed with your request as written, please let me know and I will update the expected timeline for processing the request.  I look forward to receiving a reply from you about how you would like to proceed with your request.

Sincerely,

Kirk Barney

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Francisco Gomez and Amber Donovan
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sites,

Per RCW 42.56. 250(12), I am providing you with a copy of the third party notification to Ms. Carnahan (formerly Donovan), as attached hereto.

Please note, the record has been redacted per RCW 42.56.230(3).  Ms. Carnahan's personal email address has been redacted because disclosing it would violate her right to privacy.  Please also note that, due to a delay in providing the notification and the need to provide her with 10 days' notice before releasing the records, our initial installment of responsive records will be delayed approximately one week, to February 9,, 2023.

Finally, please see my previous email below regarding a possible narrowing of the other item from your December 8, 2022 request, to which you have not yet responded.  Have a good day.

Sincerely,

Kirk Barney

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Francisco Gomez and Amber Donovan
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sites,

Attached is the first installment of records responsive to your request for "Any records or emails pertaining to Amber Donovan that have anything to do with lewd texting and videos being sent to subordinates. Focusing in on her position as Custodial manager, Coordinator. Between the years of 2020 to 2022."  A redaction log is also included.

The district will continue its search for records for this request and also for "Any records or emails pertaining to Cisco Gomez. Focusing in on his position as Maintenance and Grounds Supervisor. Looking for information related to complaints about him from staff. Include any emails from John Mannix, Karen Mooseker, Keith Stefenson and District Office staff that have anything to do about any complaints from staff against Cisco Gomez. Between the years of 2015 to 2022."

As another reminder, on January 25 I invited you to narrow your search to help expedite the search for records responsive to the Cisco Gomez item above.  After further searching, we have reduced the number of potentially responsive email records to 12,810, which will take a significant amount of time to review.  Absent an updated request to revise our search, we will continue to search based on your original request.

At this time. we anticipate a second installment of records will be sent to you no later than April 1, 2023.

Sincerely,

Kirk Barney

title: Florida College Presidents' Pledge to Stop 'Critical Race Theory' (Northwest Florida State College)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Florida College Presidents' Pledge to Stop 'Critical Race Theory' (Northwest Florida State College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any records reflecting or documenting action by your institution as a result of, or intended to satisfy, the commitments made in the January 18, 2023, "Florida College System Presidents Statement on Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Critical Race Theory," available at https://www.fldoe.org/core/fileparse.php/5673/urlt/FCSDEIstatement.pdf.  This request includes, but is not limited to, any memoranda, emails, directives, instructions, or guidance issued to administrators, staff, faculty, or employees concerning the January 18 statement. It also includes, but is not limited to, any calendar entries concerning the January 18 statement. 

2. Any communications to or from the president or provost of your institution (including, but not limited to, memoranda, emails, text messages, or social media messages) concerning the January 18 statement.

3. Any records (including correspondence) sent to the provided in response to Memo No. 23-021, sent on December 28, 2022 by Chris Spencer, Director of the Office of Policy and Budget, directing each institution of higher education to provide certain information by Friday, January 13, 2023.

Please note that this request does not seek a search of faculty or student email accounts or records. These requests should in no way be construed to include a review or search of email accounts, websites, or other forms of data or document retention which are controlled by students, alumni, or faculty members, nor by governmental or advisory bodies controlled by the same, except insofar as any such individuals also serve in an administrative capacity and the records were created or are held by the individual in that capacity. Any search should be limited to documents held by the administration and/or its staff members, including records created or maintained by persons acting in the capacity of administrators or staff members.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Re: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Florida College Presidents' Pledge to Stop 'Critical Race Theory' (Northwest Florida State College)
communications.communication:
Good afternoon:



Northwest Florida State College has received your public records request.  In accordance with Florida Statutes Chapter 119, we will promptly determine whether we possess public records responsive to your request and contact you to deliver any responsive records or with information regarding any fee or need for clarification.


Thank you,


Olivia Danner



[cid:b45ab543-621a-4b75-a6ba-289bf0347969]




Olivia Danner

Legal Assistant

Northwest Florida State College

(850) 729.5233

title: NYC CCRB supplemental data

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: NYC CCRB supplemental data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Records showing, for each inactive and active uniformed member of service of the NYPD, the following information:
* MOS tax ID
* MOS sex
* MOS race/ethinicity
* MOS age (or year of birth)
* Date MOS was appointed to NYPD
* History of ranks held by MOS, with dates of changes in rank and shield number associated with each rank held by MOS
* History of command assignment of MOS, with date MOS was assigned to each new command
* MOS highest level of educational achievement
* Each allegation of misconduct lodged with the CCRB against the MOS, with the following information:
      -- CCRB case number
      -- IAB Log number if available
      -- agency that allegation was investigated by (ie please indicate referrals to IAB, Chief of Department, or other agencies, or if CCRB kept the allegation)
      -- whether the allegation was fully investigated
      -- race, sex, and age of the allegation victim
      -- if possible, a unique identifier for alleged victims so that victims filing more than one complaint can be connected across multiple cases
      -- precinct of occurrence
      -- address of occurrence (can be anonymized to the nearest 100 street address or to street segment/intersection)
      -- reason for initial contact
      -- criminal justice outcome of incident (e.g. arrest, summons, neither)
      -- whether BWC footage was available
      -- whether video was available from another source
      -- whether victim was injured
      -- whether officer was injured
      -- FADO category and specification (e.g. search, physical force, rude gesture, etc) of misconduct alleged
      -- date of occurrence, date of filing of complaint, date of filing of recommendations by CCRB staff, date of disposition by CCRB Board for each allegation
      -- outcome recommended to the CCRB Board by staff
      -- CCRB Board disposition
      -- For substantiated allegations, whether DAO or APU prosecuted and the disposition (ie dropped by prosecutor, pleaded guilty, trial)
      -- For cases tried, whether tried at OATH or DCT and the recommendation of the trial hearing officer/commissioner/ALJ
      -- Final disposition of allegation by the Police Commissioner
      -- for Command A or Command B disciplinary outcomes (pleas, summarily imposed, or after trial), please give the actual penalty imposed at the command 

If a modification of this request would assist in easier fulfillment (e.g. to drop a particular category of information that presents difficulties), please contact me by email to discuss the issue.

Please provide the information electronically in a spreadsheet format (Excel, .csv) if possible, with all text machine-readable.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Daniel Bodah

communications.subject: [OpenRecords] Request FOIL-2021-054-00269 Acknowledged
communications.communication:
The Civilian Complaint Review Board (CCRB) has acknowledged your FOIL request FOIL-2021-054-00269. (https://a860-openrecords.nyc.gov/request/view/FOIL-2021-054-00269) You can expect a response on or about Friday, February 18, 2022. 
Additional Information: 
We are currently processing and refining our data so that it can be accurately represented in datasets. As such, it will take some additional time to get the data that you are requesting. Some of the data may be provided on a rolling basis as we prepare it.

Please be advised that the CCRB is still in the process of reviewing the records you requested pursuant to the Freedom of Information Law (FOIL). title: Michigan Freedom of Information Act. Request: Michigan Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Michigan Freedom of Information Act. Request: Michigan Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the { Michigan Freedom of Information Act. }, I hereby request the following records:

- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.
- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within { 5 days }.

Sincerely,

{ Kayla Henson }

$  127,957,373

$  123,395,844

$  127,859,224

$  136,973,439
